intro: Calonema cairnsianum, commonly known as the Cairns calonema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Gesneriaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in regions of Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its compact, evergreen foliage and produces small, showy flowers in shades of pink and white. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. Calonema cairnsianum requires well-draining soil and consistent moisture to flourish.
